events.title: Cole Porter is injured while horse riding

movie.title: De-Lovely
movie.plot: From Paris to Venice to Broadway to Hollywood, the lives of Cole Porter and his wife, Linda were never less than glamorous and wildly unconventional. And though Cole's thirst for life strained their marriage, Linda never stopped being his muse, inspiring some of the greatest sons of the twentieth century.
movie.awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 2 wins & 11 nominations.

events.title: Charles Dumont offers his song "Non, je ne regrette rien" to Édith Piaf

movie.title: La Vie en Rose
movie.plot: From the mean streets of the Belleville district of Paris to the dazzling limelight of New York's most famous concert halls, Edith Piaf's life was a constant battle to sing and survive, to live and love. Raised in her grandmother's brothel, Piaf was discovered in 1935 by nightclub owner Louis Leplee, who persuaded her to sing despite her extreme nervousness. Piaf became one of France's immortal icons, her voice one of the indelible signatures of the 20th century.

movie.title: Rush
movie.plot: A biographical drama centered on the rivalry between Formula 1 drivers James Hunt and Niki Lauda during the 1976 Formula One motor-racing season.
movie.awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 6 wins & 63 nominations.

movie.title: Incredibles 2
movie.plot: Elastigirl springs into action to save the day, while Mr. Incredible faces his greatest challenge yet – taking care of the problems of his three children.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 12 wins & 73 nominations.
